result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeneane T. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan
*Any bond monies are to be applied to the fine/costs

*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeneane T. Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice

Defendant Jeneane T. Allen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:44 a.m.  Atty Molepske calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Pay $50 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide a DNA sample
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan
Any bond monies are to be posted to the fine/costs

ADDRESS INFO for Jeneane T. Allen
Current: 3015 Kay Street, Sayner, WI 54560 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2016)
Prior: 6979 E School Street, Apartment 4, Three Lakes, WI 54562
Plea hearing on November 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:52 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

Court reviews the record. Notice in the file states this notice was sent to reported address.  
Notice appears to have been returned, undeliverable, unable to forward.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, does not know where his client is, has lost contact since right after the PTC in July.

State requests warrant for Defendant for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, gives brief background on the case, requests the Court to hold off on signing warrant or opportunity to pay a cash alternative.

Court is inclined to set this for a date due to the address. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeneane T. Allen
Current: 6979 E School Street, Apartment 4, Three Lakes, WI 54562   (Effective: 10-21-2016)
Prior: 6979 E School Street, Three Lakes, WI 54562
Plea hearing on October 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
filed by ADA E.C.
to Appear
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:50 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Atty Drengler files an authorization to appear. 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

Bond continued.
Warrant had been previously quashed.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
16R 059437 - cash alternative for failure to appear at initial appearance on 04/11/16
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on June 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
cc: DA w/minutes 04/12/16 sp
filed by Atty Ryan Drengler
$250 cash alternative  - sent to JR 04-12-16 ss

2:04 p.m. Defendant Jeneane T. Allen not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State request warrant with cash alternative. Atty Drengler states he is uncertain of her whereabouts. BTC: Bench Warrant w/$250 cash alternative.
Atty Ryan Drengler appointed

No contact with Kohls. 
Not to commit any further criminal activity.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Acalia Halverson appears in Court. 

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Retail Theft.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  4/11/16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
